Posts.Content: Lcqc wrote: Im 34 no history of breast cancer in the family. I noticed a lump about 4-5 months ago. I am currently breastfeeding my 6.5 month old son I thought the lump was normal due to breastfeeding then i learned that milk ducts don't stay full constantly. I had an ultrasound almost a month ago and he found the lump and a swollen intramammary lymph node, I left feeling fine because radiologist said he thinks it's a Galactocele and that nodes can get swollen when breastfeeding. He didn't sound confident in that but I didn't think much of it. Then I got my CBC results back and I have high lymphocytes, high immature granulocytes, high ipf and mpv, so I started googling and that's when I started to realize maybe it's cancer. I got a copy of my u/s report and it says the lump is oval solid cystic mass measuring 17x6x10 mm. The intramammery lymph node is 6x5x8 mm. Birads 4 (no letter) Off to google again and I found a radiology website that says that lymph nodes with a cortex thicker than 3mm are a "strong predictor of malignancy". Now I am convinced it's cancer. Between the lymph node, the lump and the blood work what else could it be? My biopsy is in 4 days. I've been an emotional roller coaster. My hubby says I'm reading the report differently than it really is and I'm okay. He says it's a Birads 4 just so they can do a biopsy and the radiologist used to the words "mildly suspicious" so not to be worried. My questions are.. Has anyone had or seen a swollen lymph and lump both turn out to be nothing? Any ideas on my blood work? Breastfeeding and the biopsy they said it's ok to continue nursing but I'm nervous. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: swollen intramammery lymph. Lump in breast and nursing Lcqc Moderators
